In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **W** serves the following purposes:

- w represents a [worm](/wiki/Worm "Worm"):

  - w [baby long worm](/wiki/Baby_long_worm "Baby long worm")
  - w [baby purple worm](/wiki/Baby_purple_worm "Baby purple worm")
  - w [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm")
  - w [purple worm](/wiki/Purple_worm "Purple worm")

* W represents a [wraith](/wiki/Wraith_\(monster_class\) "Wraith (monster class)"):

  - W [barrow wight](/wiki/Barrow_wight "Barrow wight")
  - W [wraith](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith")
  - W [Nazgul](/wiki/Nazgul "Nazgul")

- Press [w]() to [wield](/wiki/Wield "Wield") a [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon").
- Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [w]() to [wear](/wiki/Wear "Wear") [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor").
- In [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode"), press [ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl") + [w]() to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for something.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 AceHack](#AceHack)
  - [2.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.4 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [2.5 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [2.6 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.7 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.8 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

## Historical uses

In hack121, a port of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), the wraith uses the w glyph, while the [wumpus](/wiki/Wumpus "Wumpus") uses the W glyph. In PDP-11 Hack and [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), the W glyph is given to the wraith, and the w glyph is given to the long worm. Both monsters retain their glyph for their appearance in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), though the wumpus could also be represented by a w depending on if the NOWORM [compile-time option](/wiki/Compile-time_option "Compile-time option") was enabled or disabled. All monsters retained their glyphs up to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the wraith and worm [monster classes](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") were established, and the long worm was made a default monster - the wumpus was made a default monster as well and moved to the [quadruped](/wiki/Quadruped "Quadruped") monster class, q.

## Variants

Some variants of *NetHack* merge the [ghost](/wiki/Ghost_\(monster_class\) "Ghost (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") into the wraith monster class for better visibility.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds several monsters that use the w and W glyphs:

- w worm:

  - w [larva](/wiki/Larva "Larva")
  - w [maggot](/wiki/Maggot "Maggot")
  - w [dung worm](/wiki/Dung_worm "Dung worm")
  - w [acid worm](/wiki/Acid_worm "Acid worm")
  - w [bloodworm](/wiki/Bloodworm "Bloodworm")
  - w [tunnel worm](/wiki/Tunnel_worm "Tunnel worm")
  - w [rot worm](/wiki/Rot_worm "Rot worm")

- W wraith:
  - W [wight](/wiki/Wight "Wight")

The above also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### AceHack

In [AceHack](/wiki/AceHack "AceHack"), the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to make them more visible to players. This is also applicable to [Nethack 4](/wiki/Nethack_4 "Nethack 4") and [FIQhack](/wiki/FIQhack "FIQhack").

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds several monsters that use the w and W glyphs:

- w worm:

  - w [dark worm](/wiki/Dark_worm "Dark worm")
  - w [hunting horror](/wiki/Hunting_horror "Hunting horror")
  - w [wide clubbed tentacle](/index.php?title=Wide_clubbed_tentacle\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wide clubbed tentacle (page does not exist)")
  - w [worm that walks](/index.php?title=Worm_that_walks_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Worm that walks (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
  - w [parasitic mind flayer](/index.php?title=Parasitic_mind_flayer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitic mind flayer (page does not exist)")
  - w [parasitic master mind flayer](/index.php?title=Parasitic_master_mind_flayer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitic master mind flayer (page does not exist)")
  - w [long sinuous tentacle](/index.php?title=Long_sinuous_tentacle\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Long sinuous tentacle (page does not exist)")
  - w [crimson writher](/index.php?title=Crimson_writher\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Crimson writher (page does not exist)")

- W wraith:

  - W [phantasm](/wiki/Phantasm "Phantasm")
  - W [zarielite zealot](/index.php?title=Zarielite_zealot\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Zarielite zealot (page does not exist)")
  - W [zarielite heretic](/index.php?title=Zarielite_heretic\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Zarielite heretic (page does not exist)")
  - W [Necromancer](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer")
  - W [Vechernyaya the Sun's Grave-keeper](/index.php?title=Vechernyaya_the_Sun%27s_Grave-keeper\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Vechernyaya the Sun's Grave-keeper (page does not exist)")
  - W [bright walker](/index.php?title=Bright_walker\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Bright walker (page does not exist)")
  - W [flaxen starshadow](/index.php?title=Flaxen_starshadow\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Flaxen starshadow (page does not exist)")
  - W [flaxen star-phantom](/index.php?title=Flaxen_star-phantom\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Flaxen star-phantom (page does not exist)")

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class as in NetHack 4, and the [manes](/wiki/Manes "Manes") is also moved to the monster class at W.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to avoid using punctuation for monster glyphs and make them more visible.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds a few monsters that use the w and W glyphs:

- w worm:
  - w [maggot](/index.php?title=Maggot_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Maggot (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")

- W wraith:

  - W [bodak](/index.php?title=Bodak\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Bodak (page does not exist)")
  - W [banshee](/index.php?title=Banshee\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Banshee (page does not exist)")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds two monsters that use the w glyph:

- w worm:

  - w [giant leech](/wiki/Giant_leech "Giant leech")
  - w [neothelid](/wiki/Neothelid_\(EvilHack\) "Neothelid (EvilHack)")

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds many monsters that use the w and W glyphs, including several from other variants:

- w worm:

  - w [larva](/wiki/Larva "Larva")
  - w [maggot](/wiki/Maggot "Maggot")
  - w [dung worm](/wiki/Dung_worm "Dung worm")
  - w [acid worm](/wiki/Acid_worm "Acid worm")
  - w [bloodworm](/wiki/Bloodworm "Bloodworm")
  - w [tunnel worm](/wiki/Tunnel_worm "Tunnel worm")
  - w [rot worm](/wiki/Rot_worm "Rot worm")
  - w [giant leech](/wiki/Giant_leech "Giant leech")
  - w [neothelid](/wiki/Neothelid_\(EvilHack\) "Neothelid (EvilHack)")
  - w [hellminth](/index.php?title=Hellminth\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hellminth (page does not exist)")

- W wraith:

  - W [bodak](/index.php?title=Bodak\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Bodak (page does not exist)")
  - W [banshee](/index.php?title=Banshee\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Banshee (page does not exist)")
  - W [slaughter wight](/index.php?title=Slaughter_wight\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Slaughter wight (page does not exist)")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

W

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter W serves the following purposes:

  • w represents a worm:
    • w baby long worm
    • w baby purple worm
    • w long worm
    • w purple worm
  • W represents a wraith:
    • W barrow wight
    • W wraith
    • W Nazgul
  • Press w to wield a weapon.
  • Press shift + w to wear armor.
  • In wizard mode, press ctrl + w to wish for something.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 AceHack
    • 2.3 dNetHack
    • 2.4 NetHack Fourk
    • 2.5 xNetHack
    • 2.6 SpliceHack
    • 2.7 EvilHack
    • 2.8 Hack'EM

Historical uses

In hack121, a port of Jay Fenlason's Hack, the wraith uses the w glyph, while the wumpus uses the W glyph. In PDP-11 Hack and Hack 1.0, the W glyph is given to the wraith, and the w glyph is given to the long worm. Both monsters retain their glyph for their appearance in Hack 1.0, though the wumpus could also be represented by a w depending on if the NOWORM compile-time option was enabled or disabled. All monsters retained their glyphs up to NetHack 2.3e.

In NetHack 3.0.0, the wraith and worm monster classes were established, and the long worm was made a default monster - the wumpus was made a default monster as well and moved to the quadruped monster class, q.

Variants

Some variants of NetHack merge the ghost monster class into the wraith monster class for better visibility.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds several monsters that use the w and W glyphs:

  • w worm:
    • w larva
    • w maggot
    • w dung worm
    • w acid worm
    • w bloodworm
    • w tunnel worm
    • w rot worm
  • W wraith:
    • W wight

The above also applies to SlashTHEM.

AceHack

In AceHack, the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to make them more visible to players. This is also applicable to Nethack 4 and FIQhack.

dNetHack

dNetHack adds several monsters that use the w and W glyphs:

  • w worm:
    • w dark worm
    • w hunting horror
    • w wide clubbed tentacle
    • w worm that walks
    • w parasitic mind flayer
    • w parasitic master mind flayer
    • w long sinuous tentacle
    • w crimson writher
  • W wraith:
    • W phantasm
    • W zarielite zealot
    • W zarielite heretic
    • W Necromancer
    • W Vechernyaya the Sun's Grave-keeper
    • W bright walker
    • W flaxen starshadow
    • W flaxen star-phantom

NetHack Fourk

In NetHack Fourk, the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class as in NetHack 4, and the manes is also moved to the monster class at W.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to avoid using punctuation for monster glyphs and make them more visible.

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds a few monsters that use the w and W glyphs:

  • w worm:
    • w maggot
  • W wraith:
    • W bodak
    • W banshee

EvilHack

EvilHack adds two monsters that use the w glyph:

  • w worm:
    • w giant leech
    • w neothelid

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds many monsters that use the w and W glyphs, including several from other variants:

  • w worm:
    • w larva
    • w maggot
    • w dung worm
    • w acid worm
    • w bloodworm
    • w tunnel worm
    • w rot worm
    • w giant leech
    • w neothelid
    • w hellminth
  • W wraith:
    • W bodak
    • W banshee
    • W slaughter wight

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the letter '''W''' serves the following purposes:

* {{white|w}} represents a [[worm]]:
** {{monsymlink|baby long worm}}
** {{monsymlink|baby purple worm}}
** {{monsymlink|long worm}}
** {{monsymlink|purple worm}}

* {{white|W}} represents a [[Wraith (monster class)|wraith]]:
** {{monsymlink|barrow wight}}
** {{monsymlink|wraith}}
** {{monsymlink|Nazgul}}

* Press {{kbd|w}} to [[wield]] a [[weapon]].
* Press {{kbd|shift|w}} to [[wear]] [[armor]].
* In [[wizard mode]], press {{kbd|ctrl|w}} to [[wish]] for something.

==Historical uses==
In hack121, a port of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], the wraith uses the {{white|w}} glyph, while the [[wumpus]] uses the {{white|W}} glyph. In PDP-11 Hack and [[Hack 1.0]], the {{white|W}} glyph is given to the wraith, and the {{white|w}} glyph is given to the long worm. Both monsters retain their glyph for their appearance in [[Hack 1.0]], though the wumpus could also be represented by a {{white|w}} depending on if the NOWORM [[compile-time option]] was enabled or disabled. All monsters retained their glyphs up to [[NetHack 2.3e]].

In [[NetHack 3.0.0]], the wraith and worm [[monster class]]es were established, and the long worm was made a default monster - the wumpus was made a default monster as well and moved to the [[quadruped]] monster class, {{white|q}}.

==Variants==
Some variants of ''NetHack'' merge the [[Ghost (monster class)|ghost]] [[monster class]] into the wraith monster class for better visibility.

===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] adds several monsters that use the {{white|w}} and {{white|W}} glyphs:

* {{white|w}} worm:
** {{monsymlink|larva}}
** {{monsymlink|maggot}}
** {{monsymlink|dung worm}}
** {{monsymlink|acid worm}}
** {{monsymlink|bloodworm}}
** {{monsymlink|tunnel worm}}
** {{monsymlink|rot worm}}
* {{white|W}} wraith:
** {{monsymlink|wight}}

The above also applies to [[SlashTHEM]].

===AceHack===
In [[AceHack]], the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to make them more visible to players. This is also applicable to [[Nethack 4]] and [[FIQhack]].

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] adds several monsters that use the {{white|w}} and {{white|W}} glyphs:

* {{white|w}} worm:
** {{black|w}} [[dark worm]]
** {{yellow|w}} [[hunting horror]]
** {{brightmagenta|w}} [[wide clubbed tentacle]]
** {{white|w}} [[Worm that walks (dNetHack)|worm that walks]]
** {{brightmagenta|w}} [[parasitic mind flayer]]
** {{brightmagenta|w}} [[parasitic master mind flayer]]
** {{brightmagenta|w}} [[long sinuous tentacle]]
** {{red|w}} [[crimson writher]]
* {{white|W}} wraith:
** {{red|W}} [[phantasm]]
** {{white|W}} [[zarielite zealot]]
** {{orange|W}} [[zarielite heretic]]
** {{magenta|W}} [[Necromancer]]
** {{black|W}} [[Vechernyaya the Sun's Grave-keeper]]
** {{yellow|W}} [[bright walker]]
** {{yellow|W}} [[flaxen starshadow]]
** {{yellow|W}} [[flaxen star-phantom]]

===NetHack Fourk===
In [[NetHack Fourk]], the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class as in NetHack 4, and the [[manes]] is also moved to the monster class at {{red|W}}.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], the ghost monster class is merged into the wraith monster class to avoid using punctuation for monster glyphs and make them more visible.

===SpliceHack===
[[SpliceHack]] adds a few monsters that use the {{white|w}} and {{white|W}} glyphs:

* {{white|w}} worm:
** {{green|w}} [[Maggot (SpliceHack)|maggot]]
* {{white|W}} wraith:
** {{yellow|W}} [[bodak]]
** {{cyan|W}} [[banshee]]

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] adds two monsters that use the {{white|w}} glyph:

* {{white|w}} worm:
** {{black|w}} [[giant leech]]
** {{magenta|w}} [[Neothelid (EvilHack)|neothelid]]

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] adds many monsters that use the {{white|w}} and {{white|W}} glyphs, including several from other variants:

* {{white|w}} worm:
** {{monsymlink|larva}}
** {{monsymlink|maggot}}
** {{monsymlink|dung worm}}
** {{monsymlink|acid worm}}
** {{monsymlink|bloodworm}}
** {{monsymlink|tunnel worm}}
** {{monsymlink|rot worm}}
** {{black|w}} [[giant leech]]
** {{magenta|w}} [[Neothelid (EvilHack)|neothelid]]
** {{green|w}} [[hellminth]]
* {{white|W}} wraith:
** {{yellow|W}} [[bodak]]
** {{cyan|W}} [[banshee]]
** {{red|W}} [[slaughter wight]]

[[Category:ASCII]]
